[HEADING] Welcoming Ceremony Presentation
Welcome to the Faculty of Engineering.  You have certainly made the right choice to pursue your Higher Degree here at University of Malaya.  We have an exceptional track record in terms of our curriculum, research, our experienced team of staff and most of all, our QS World Rankings speaks volume for itself.
How is our engineering postgraduate degree different?
Research is a key activity within the faculty and we encourage large-scale studies and a flexible approach to interdisciplinary collaborations with other academic institutions and members of the industry in order to tackle the wider range of issues facing our society and the natural world.
The Faculty of Engineering has invested heavily in the student experience and places research-led teaching at the core of our programme. We endeavour to fully support our students and researchers in their research activities and encourage them to accomplish their aims - regardless of whether their studies focus on a single academic field or address wider challenges that are shaped by the emerging needs of industry and society. In many areas, our students are clearly leading the world in their discoveries and developments.
Why pursue a postgraduate degree in engineering?
Engineering is not simply an academic field that deals with technology, statistics and science. It is an exciting and rewarding discipline that has a much wider scope, ranging from basic science to applied technology. Engineers make a significant difference in the lives of millions of people. Through identifying problems and seeking new solutions, they create and design items that benefit the lives of everyone, from cars, computers and buildings, through to life-saving equipment, the generation of energy and medical procedures. Engineering is not about what the world is, it is about what the world can be.
To be admitted to a Master‘s programme, applicants will need to have completed a recognized Bachelor’s degree in a relevant discipline and to have obtained a good average cumulative grade point average (CGPA).
Minimum Requirements:
A Bachelor’s Degree (Hons.) or its equivalent in related engineering field;
Preference will be given to applicants having a Bachelor’s Degree with CGPA 3.0 and above or its equivalent.
Applicants having a Bachelor’s Degree with CGPA 3.7 and above can apply directly for the Doctoral programme (subject to students graduated from higher education institutions in Malaysia only)
International applicants are required to have:
DOCTOR OF PHILOSOPHY (PhD)
To be admitted to a PhD programme, applicants will need to have completed and obtained a good average cumulative grade point average (CGPA) the following :-
- Preference will be given to applicants having a Masters and
Bachelor’s Degree with CGPA 3.0 and above or its equivalent.
- An interview  session may be required for selected applicants

• TOEFL score of 550 (paper-based) / 213 (computer-based) / 80 (Internet-based); or
• Band 4 and above in the Malaysian University English Test (MUET); or
• A score of 51 and above in the Pearson Test of Academic English (PTE Academic); or
• A Grade C and above in English for General Certificate of Education (A Level), University of Cambridge; or
• A Grade C and above in the Cambridge Assessment English: First (FCE); or
• A Grade C and above in the Cambridge Assessment English: Advanced (CAE); or
• A Grade C and above in the Cambridge Assessment English: Proficiency (CPE).
• a Master’s degree by Research related in engineering field; or
• a Master’s degree by Mixed mode related in engineering field; or
• a Master’s degree by Coursework related in engineering field; and
• a Bachelor’s degree related in engineering field;

Entry Requirement
MASTERTo be admitted to a Master‘s programme, applicants will need to have completed a recognized Bachelor’s degree in a relevant discipline and to have obtained a good average cumulative grade point average (CGPA).Minimum Requirements:A Bachelor’s Degree (Hons.) or its equivalent in related engineering field;*NotePreference will be given to applicants having a Bachelor’s Degree with CGPA 3.0 and above or its equivalent.Applicants having a Bachelor’s Degree with CGPA 3.7 and above can apply directly for the Doctoral programme (subject to students graduated from higher education institutions in Malaysia only)International applicants are required to have:IELTS Band 5.5 (Academic); orTOEFL score of 550 (paper-based) / 213 (computer-based) / 80 (Internet-based); orBand 4 and above in the Malaysian University English Test (MUET); orA score of 51 and above in the Pearson Test of Academic English (PTE Academic); orA Grade C and above in English for General Certificate of Education (A Level), University of Cambridge; orA Grade C and above in the Cambridge Assessment English: First (FCE); orA Grade C and above in the Cambridge Assessment English: Advanced (CAE); orA Grade C and above in the Cambridge Assessment English: Proficiency (CPE).DOCTOR OF PHILOSOPHY (PhD)To be admitted to a PhD programme, applicants will need to have completed and obtained a good average cumulative grade point average (CGPA) the following :-a Master’s degree by Research related in engineering field; ora Master’s degree by Mixed mode related in engineering field; ora Master’s degree by Coursework related in engineering field; anda Bachelor’s degree related in engineering field;*Note- Preference will be given to applicants having a Masters and  Bachelor’s Degree with CGPA 3.0 and above or its equivalent.- An interview  session may be required for selected applicantsInternational applicants are required to have:IELTS Band 5.5 (Academic); orTOEFL score of 550 (paper-based) / 213 (computer-based) / 80 (Internet-based); orBand 4 and above in the Malaysian University English Test (MUET); orA score of 51 and above in the Pearson Test of Academic English (PTE Academic); orA Grade C and above in English for General Certificate of Education (A Level), University of Cambridge; orA Grade C and above in the Cambridge Assessment English: First (FCE); orA Grade C and above in the Cambridge Assessment English: Advanced (CAE); orA Grade C and above in the Cambridge Assessment English: Proficiency (CPE).
[CARD]

pages.content:
[HEADING] Master of Road Safety Engineering
[HEADING] Programme Educational Objectives (PEO)
[HEADING] Programme Learning Outcomes (PLO)
[HEADING] Mode of Study
[HEADING] Career Path
[HEADING] Course Content Structure
[HEADING] Programme Fee
[HEADING] Programme Application
[HEADING] Scholarship
[HEADING] Entry Requirements Information
[HEADING] Contact Us
PLO 1: Demonstrate continuing advanced knowledge and able to further develop the knowledge in solving complex road safety problems.
PLO 2: Analyze complex road safety problems or issues critically and provide solutions through the application of specialized concepts and / or methods.
PLO 3: Apply and design appropriate solutions to road safety problems using appropriate research methods, tools and approaches.
PLO 4: Communicate ideas and rationales using appropriate methods as individuals or groups, experts or non-experts ethically, critically and professionally.
PLO 5: Demonstrate competency by combining digital technology as well as appropriate software and statistics in resolving complex road safety issues and problems.
PLO 6: Demonstrates high leadership, responsible and interpersonal skills in planning and management of road safety project.
PLO 7: Identify the need for continuous and sustainable professional development and entrepreneurial elements in the context of road safety.
PLO 8: Demonstrate adherence to ethical and professional codes of practice in planning and execution of the technical or research project relevant to road safety.
Pn. Maznah Mohammad Zin (Postgraduate Studies Unit)Email address: maznah_mohammadzin@um.edu.myTel. No.: +603-79675298
Ir. Ts. Dr. Yuen Choon Wah (Coordinator of Master of Road Safety Engineering)Email address: yuencw@um.edu.myTel. No: +603-79675355
Last Update: 04/08/2025
• Faculty of Engineering
• engine@um.edu.my
• +6037967 5200
• Home
• Master of Road Safety Engineering
• ROAD SAFETY AUDITOR
• HIGHWAY ENGINEER
• TRANSPORT PLANNER
• ENFORCEMENT OFFICER
• TRAFFIC ENGINEER .
[HTML_TABLE]
Programme Learning Outcomes (PLO) | Taxonomy Category (C/P/A)
PLO 1: Demonstrate continuing advanced knowledge and able to further develop the knowledge in solving complex road safety problems. | C
PLO 2: Analyze complex road safety problems or issues critically and provide solutions through the application of specialized concepts and / or methods. | C
PLO 3: Apply and design appropriate solutions to road safety problems using appropriate research methods, tools and approaches. | C, P
PLO 4: Communicate ideas and rationales using appropriate methods as individuals or groups, experts or non-experts ethically, critically and professionally. | C, A
PLO 5: Demonstrate competency by combining digital technology as well as appropriate software and statistics in resolving complex road safety issues and problems. | C, P
PLO 6: Demonstrates high leadership, responsible and interpersonal skills in planning and management of road safety project. | A
PLO 7: Identify the need for continuous and sustainable professional development and entrepreneurial elements in the context of road safety. | A
PLO 8: Demonstrate adherence to ethical and professional codes of practice in planning and execution of the technical or research project relevant to road safety. | A
[HTML_TABLE]
List of Subject
Core Subject | Credit Hour
1 | Research Methodology | 3
2 | Project Management | 3
3 | Research project | 12
4 | Traffic Engineering and Safety | 3
5 | Road Safety Management | 3
6 | Data Analytic Applications in Road Safety | 3
7 | Road Safety Audit and Traffic Risk Analysis | 3
8 | Traffic Crash Analysis | 3
 | Sub-Total Credit Hour | 33
Select 3 electives (3 credit hour) from ANY subject below:Human Behaviour in Road Safety Intelligent Transport System in Road SafetySustainable Transport SystemTraffic Modelling, Simulation and SafetyUrban Transport Planning and SafetyVehicle Safety System | 333333
Sub-Total Credit Hour | 9
TOTAL CREDIT HOUR | 42
[GRID_TABLE]
Programme Educational Objectives (PEO)
PEO1: Graduates practice professional leadership in the field of road safety.PEO2: Graduates engage in Research and Development activities in road safety for their career development.PEO3: Graduates contribute actively in sustainable development of road safety, and well-being of society.
Programme Learning Outcomes (PLO) Taxonomy Category (C/P/A)PLO 1: Demonstrate continuing advanced knowledge and able to further develop the knowledge in solving complex road safety problems.    CPLO 2: Analyze complex road safety problems or issues critically and provide solutions through the application of specialized concepts and / or methods.   CPLO 3: Apply and design appropriate solutions to road safety problems using appropriate research methods, tools and approaches.    C, PPLO 4: Communicate ideas and rationales using appropriate methods as individuals or groups, experts or non-experts ethically, critically and professionally.  C, APLO 5: Demonstrate competency by combining digital technology as well as appropriate software and statistics in resolving complex road safety issues and problems.     C, PPLO 6: Demonstrates high leadership, responsible and interpersonal skills in planning and management of road safety project.  APLO 7: Identify the need for continuous and sustainable professional development and entrepreneurial elements in the context of road safety. APLO 8: Demonstrate adherence to ethical and professional codes of practice in planning and execution of the technical or research project relevant to road safety. A
BY COURSEWORK (FULL TIME) OR (PART TIME) . Full-time refers to studies followed by students with a minimum of 14 credits in one normal semester. Part-time refers to studies followed by students with a maximum of 14 credits in a normal semester.

[CARD]
Programme Learning Outcomes (PLO)
Programme Learning Outcomes (PLO) Taxonomy Category (C/P/A)PLO 1: Demonstrate continuing advanced knowledge and able to further develop the knowledge in solving complex road safety problems.    CPLO 2: Analyze complex road safety problems or issues critically and provide solutions through the application of specialized concepts and / or methods.   CPLO 3: Apply and design appropriate solutions to road safety problems using appropriate research methods, tools and approaches.    C, PPLO 4: Communicate ideas and rationales using appropriate methods as individuals or groups, experts or non-experts ethically, critically and professionally.  C, APLO 5: Demonstrate competency by combining digital technology as well as appropriate software and statistics in resolving complex road safety issues and problems.     C, PPLO 6: Demonstrates high leadership, responsible and interpersonal skills in planning and management of road safety project.  APLO 7: Identify the need for continuous and sustainable professional development and entrepreneurial elements in the context of road safety. APLO 8: Demonstrate adherence to ethical and professional codes of practice in planning and execution of the technical or research project relevant to road safety. A
[CARD]
Programme Learning Outcomes (PLO)
Programme Learning Outcomes (PLO)
[CARD]
Programme Learning Outcomes (PLO) Taxonomy Category (C/P/A)PLO 1: Demonstrate continuing advanced knowledge and able to further develop the knowledge in solving complex road safety problems.    CPLO 2: Analyze complex road safety problems or issues critically and provide solutions through the application of specialized concepts and / or methods.   CPLO 3: Apply and design appropriate solutions to road safety problems using appropriate research methods, tools and approaches.    C, PPLO 4: Communicate ideas and rationales using appropriate methods as individuals or groups, experts or non-experts ethically, critically and professionally.  C, APLO 5: Demonstrate competency by combining digital technology as well as appropriate software and statistics in resolving complex road safety issues and problems.     C, PPLO 6: Demonstrates high leadership, responsible and interpersonal skills in planning and management of road safety project.  APLO 7: Identify the need for continuous and sustainable professional development and entrepreneurial elements in the context of road safety. APLO 8: Demonstrate adherence to ethical and professional codes of practice in planning and execution of the technical or research project relevant to road safety. A
[CARD]
Mode of Study
BY COURSEWORK (FULL TIME) OR (PART TIME) . Full-time refers to studies followed by students with a minimum of 14 credits in one normal semester. Part-time refers to studies followed by students with a maximum of 14 credits in a normal semester.
[CARD]

pages.content:
[HEADING] Master of Engineering Science (MEngSc)
[HEADING] Programme Educational Objectives (PEO)
[HEADING] Programme Learning Outcomes (PLO)
[HEADING] Entry Requirements
[HEADING] English Language Requirements
[HEADING] Programme Duration
[HEADING] Mode of study
PLO1 : Demonstrate a systematic understanding of knowledge by identifying research problems in the related engineering field.
PLO2 : Apply appropriate research methodology and design.
PLO3 : Publish knowledge in the conducted research field to the benefit of community, as well as be sensitive to the role and responsibility for the needs of the society.
PLO 4 : Conduct research independently with minimum supervision and adhere to legislation, ethics and professional codes of practice.
PLO 5 : Present research findings orally and scholarly publications in the field of engineering related research.
PLO 6 : Evaluate research findings using scientific methods and critical thinking skills.
PLO 7 : Engage in information management and continuous learning activities.
Last Update: 29/11/2021
• Faculty of Engineering
• engine@um.edu.my
• +6037967 5200
• Home
• Master of Engineering Science (MEngSc)
[HTML_TABLE]
Programme Learning Outcomes (PLO) | MQF 2.0 Clusters
PLO1 : Demonstrate a systematic understanding of knowledge by identifying research problems in the related engineering field. | CLS 1
			(Knowledge and understanding)
PLO2 : Apply appropriate research methodology and design. | CLS 3a
			(Practical skills)
PLO3 : Publish knowledge in the conducted research field to the benefit of community, as well as be sensitive to the role and responsibility for the needs of the society. | CLS 3c
			(Interpersonal and communication)
PLO 4 : Conduct research independently with minimum supervision and adhere to legislation, ethics and professional codes of practice. | CLS 5
			(Ethics and Professionalism)
PLO 5 : Present research findings orally and scholarly publications in the field of engineering related research. | CLS 3d
			(Leadership, autonomous and responsible)
PLO 6 : Evaluate research findings using scientific methods and critical thinking skills. | CLS 3b
			(Digital and numerical skills)
			&
			CLS 2
			(Cognitive skills)
PLO 7 : Engage in information management and continuous learning activities. | CLS 4
			(Personal and entrepreneurial skills)
[GRID_TABLE]
PEO 1: To produce knowledgeable and skilled graduates in Engineering related research fields
PEO 2: To produce professionals in research careers
PEO 3: To equip graduates with technical expertise and soft skills by integrating research -based learning experiences into the curriculum.
Programme Learning Outcomes (PLO) 
MQF 2.0 Clusters

CLS 1

PLO 7 : Engage in information management and continuous learning activities.

 CLS 4
			(Personal and entrepreneurial skills)
Entry Requirements
A BACHELOR degree with honors in a related engineering field or equivalent degree; AND Meet other conditions set by the Senate
English Language Requirements
Have at least IELTS Band 5.5 or A Minimum Score Of 550 For Paper-based Total (PBT), A Score Of 213 For Computer-based Total (CBT) Or A Score 80 For Internet-based Total (iBT) For the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) If the Degree Is from a University Where English Is Not the Medium of Instruction.
Minimum:  2 semester  
Maximum: 8 semester
By research

PEO 2: To produce professionals in research careers
PEO 3: To equip graduates with technical expertise and soft skills by integrating research -based learning experiences into the curriculum.
